task_summary: Place the white carton from the gripper down onto the table surface and safely retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator operates over a small round table holding multiple small objects (cans, bottles, a red block). The task is to put down a small white carton that is presumed to already be grasped. The robot should align above a clear table area, descend until contact to avoid dropping, release the gripper, and back off to a safe height. Precision matters due to nearby objects and limited free space.
preconditions: White carton is already in the gripper
Arm is operational and within workspace
stepwise_plan: Verify the white carton is currently held
Approach and align above the table area
Move to a short hover above the table
Lower slowly until contact is detected
Open gripper to release the carton
success_criteria: Carton lies stably on the table
failure_and_recovery: If object not detected in gripper, abort and request human or upstream pick
If contact not detected within depth limit, retry approach or choose a different spot
If release fails, open gripper again and nudge by tiny retreat/advance
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after release and retreat complete with no collisions observed.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Confirms the white_carton is currently grasped before placing.
Align above a safe area of the table with tight tolerance.
Hover 10 cm above the table to begin the placement descent.
Lower slowly until contact is detected to avoid dropping.
Back off to clear the object and table area.

failure_modes: No contact detected within allowed depth
Carton sticks to fingers and is not released
recovery_strategy: Try a second descent with slightly different pose
assumptions: Frames suggest a central table placement scene but do not explicitly show the carton in hand; we assume it is already grasped to satisfy 'put down' wording.
Placement target interpreted as table area rather than a precise pose.

expected_success_criteria: Carton placed flat on the table
